PtSituationElement.Summary: There is no [2] or [5] service in both directions between Franklin Av and Flatbush Av because of an unauthorized person on the tracks near Flatbush Av.
PtSituationElement.Description: There is no 2 or 5 service in both directions between Franklin Av and Flatbush Av because of an unauthorized person on the tracks near Flatbush Av.
PtSituationElement.LongDescription:
There is no [2] or [5] service in both directions between Franklin Av and Flatbush Av-Brooklyn College because of an unauthorized person on the tracks near Flatbush Av-Brooklyn College . Expect delays in [2], [3], [4], and [5] service.

See a station agent to receive a courtesy pass for continuing train or bus service. Consider taking the nearby B44 bus, which operates one block west of the 2 and 5 lines. Here are directions: http://bit.ly/2NHbzcP

PtSituationElement.Summary: Northbound D trains are running express from Coney Island to 62 St because of switch problems at Bay 50 St.

PtSituationElement.LongDescription:
Northbound [D] trains are running express from Coney Island-Stillwell Av to 62 St because of switch problems at Bay 50 St.

For service to bypassed stations transfer to a southbound [D] train at Bay Pkwy.

PtSituationElement.LongDescription: We have removed the stalled train from the area and are now resuming local 71 Av-bound service between Queens Plaza and Jackson Hts-Roosevelt Av. Expect significant delays in both directions in [E], [F], [M], and [R] service as congestion clears.

[D] service operates between Norwood-205 St and 145 St, and via the [C] local in Manhattan to/from Jay St-MetroTech, Brooklyn and via the [F] to/from Stillwell Av.

[F] trains are rerouted via the [Q] express in Manhattan and replace the [D] in Brooklyn between Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and Stillwell Av.

[SB] Buses operate between W 4 St and Grand St, stopping at B'way-Lafayette St.

Travel Alternatives
In Manhattan, use nearby [N] [Q] [R] stations along Broadway, [1] [2] [3] stations along 7 Av, [A] [C] [E] stations or [SB] buses.

For Brooklyn, take the [F] instead.

Transfer in Manhattan via the passageway at Times Sq-42 St/Port Authority [1] [2] [3] [N] [Q] [R] [F] or in Brooklyn at 4 Av-9 St [F].

Transfer between [D] trains and [SB] buses at W 4 St.

PtSituationElement.Summary: FASTRACK PROGRAM Sep 10 - 13, Mon to Thu, 815 PM to 1130 PM [M] Service ends early between 71 Av, Queens and Essex St, Manhattan [E] [F] [R] trains provide alternate service
PtSituationElement.Description: FASTRACK PROGRAM Sep 10 - 13, Mon to Thu, 815 PM to 1130 PM [M] Service ends early between 71 Av, Queens and Essex St, Manhattan [E] [F] [R] trains provide alternate service
PtSituationElement.LongDescription:
FASTRACK PROGRAM | Sep 10 - 13, Mon to Thu, 8:15 PM to 11:30 PM
[M] Service ends early between 71 Av, Queens and Essex St, Manhattan

[E] [F] [R] trains provide alternate service

[M] service operates between Essex St and Metropolitan Av.

Travel Alternatives:
[R] trains make all [M] stops between 71 Av and Queens Plaza.
[E] trains make all [M] stops between Queens Plaza and 5 Av/53.
[F] trains make all [M] stops between 47-50 Sts and Delancey St/Essex St until 9:30 PM.
• Transfer between [F] and [R] trains at Roosevelt Av or 34 St-Herald Sq.
• Transfer between [E] and [F] trains at W 4 St.
• Transfer between [F] and [M] trains at Delancey St/Essex St.

After 9:30 PM, [F] trains are rerouted via the [Q] in Manhattan. For 6 Av stations and Bway-Lafayette St, use nearby Broadway [N] [Q] [R] stations.
• Transfer between [F] and [R] trains at Roosevelt Av or 34 St-Herald Sq.
• Transfer between [E] and [F] trains at W 4 St, until 9:30 PM.
• Transfer between [F] and [J] [M] trains at Delancey St/Essex St, until 9:30 PM.
• Transfer between [N] [Q] [R] and [J] trains at Canal St, [F] after 9:30 PM.

Note: Manhattan-bound [E] and [F] trains run local in Queens after 10 PM.

Reminders: Late night [M] service operates between Metropolitan Av and Myrtle Av.
23 St [F] [M] station is temporarily closed for renovation.

[ad] This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay.
